content.description: The procedure BinarySearch (numList, target) correctly implements a binary search algorithm on the list of numbers numList. The procedure returns an index where target occurs in numList, or -1 if target does not occur in numList.
content.question: Which of the following conditions must be met in order for the procedure to work as intended?

choices.label: The length of numList must be even.
The list numList must not contain any duplicate values.
The values in numList must be in sorted order.
The value of target must not be equal to -1.

content.answer: The values in numList must be in sorted order.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Investigate the situation, context, or task.
